page.title: 08INTERVIEWS AND SURVEYS
page.content: Jobs for women and girls are also available in shops and offices. -------------------------------------- My name is Sian Blackwood and I live in Trelewis. One of my tasks was to interview the people in my area asking them what they did for a living. My friends also took part and altogether we were able to question three hundred and twenty nine people. Our results were: seventy six colliery workers, thirty two shop workers, fifty one factory workers, who have to travel approximately twelve miles to work, twenty two transport workers, forty people employed by the local authority at various activities, parks, refuse collection, street cleaning etc., eleven people in the construction industry.
